ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
Django MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) extension for Django. 
This module allows MCP Clients and AI agents to interact with any Django application seamlessly.
about.summary: Django MCP Server is a Django extensions to easily enable AI Agents to interact with Django Apps through the Model Context Protocol it works equally well on WSGI and ASGI

tests.script: python -c "import django; from django.conf import settings; settings.configure(DEBUG=True,INSTALLED_APPS=['mcp_server']); django.setup(); import mcp_server;"

about.description:
Django MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) extension for Django. 
This module allows MCP Clients and AI agents to interact with any Django application seamlessly.
about.summary: Django MCP Server is a Django extensions to easily enable AI Agents to interact with Django Apps through the Model Context Protocol it works equally well on WSGI and ASGI

tests.script: python -c "import django; from django.conf import settings; settings.configure(DEBUG=True,INSTALLED_APPS=['mcp_server']); django.setup(); import mcp_server;"

name: django-mcp-server
raw_meta_yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/prefix-dev/recipe-format/main/schema.json
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: django-mcp-server
  version: "0.5.7"
  python_min: '3.10'

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/${{ name[0] }}/${{ name }}/django_mcp_server-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 5077f8fabf5fb621b5ce490afd0db60f21e57b3a451ed14a9f44aef545ea4eee

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation

requirements:
  host:
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - poetry-core
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }},<4.0
    - mcp >=1.8.0
    - django >=4.0
    - djangorestframework >=3.15.0
    - inflection >=0.5.1,<0.6.0
    - uritemplate >=4.1.1,<5.0.0

tests:
  - script:
      - python -c "import django; from django.conf import settings; settings.configure(DEBUG=True,INSTALLED_APPS=['mcp_server']); django.setup(); import mcp_server;"

  - python:
      imports:
        - django
      pip_check: true
      python_version: ${{ python_min }}.*

about:
  summary: Django MCP Server is a Django extensions to easily enable AI Agents to interact with Django Apps through the Model Context Protocol it works equally well on WSGI and ASGI
  homepage: hhttps://github.com/omarbenhamid/django-mcp-server
  description: |
    Django MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) extension for Django. 
    This module allows MCP Clients and AI agents to interact with any Django application seamlessly.
  repository: https://github.com/omarbenhamid/django-mcp-server
  documentation: https://github.com/omarbenhamid/django-mcp-server/blob/main/README.md
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENCE.md

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - rxm7706
